question: Researchers have discovered “tubarial glands”, in which part of the human body?
explanation:
Researchers from the Netherlands Cancer Institute have discovered a new location of salivary glands in the throat.
In their findings in a research published in the journal Radiotherapy and Oncology, they have named the part as “tubarial glands”. This would be useful for patients with head and neck tumours. The researchers also believe that these glands would qualify as the fourth pair of major salivary glands.
